judges: Before, Jones, C. J., Eagen, O’Brien, Bobeets, Pomeroy, Nix and Manderino, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion
per Curiam,
And Now, this 11th day of February, 1972, the petition for allowance of appeal in the above-captioned matter is granted and the judgments of sentence imposed by the Philadelphia Court of Common Pleas, Trial Division, Criminal Section, Nos. 2236, 2238 and 2240, January Term, 1967, are reversed. See, Com. v. Mills, 447 Pa. 163, 286 A. 2d 638 (1971).
opinions.author: per Curiam,

attorneys: Milton M. Stem, Assistant District Attorney, James D. Crawford, Deputy District Attorney, Richard A. Sprague, First Assistant District Attorney, and Arlen Specter, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth v. Hall, Petitioner.
Before, Jones, C. J., Eagen, O’Brien, Bobeets, Pomeroy, Nix and Manderino, JJ.
Jules N. Mmis, for appellant.
Milton M. Stem, Assistant District Attorney, James D. Crawford, Deputy District Attorney, Richard A. Sprague, First Assistant District Attorney, and Arlen Specter, District Attorney, for Commonwealth, appellee.
February 11, 1972:
